title: GT 4.0 Java CoG Kit: System Administrator's Guide

section.title: Introduction
section.para: This guide contains installation and configuration information for system administrators installing the Java CoG Kit. It explains how to install, configure and test the installation.

important.simpara: This information is in addition to the basic Globus Toolkit prerequisite, overview, installation, security configuration instructions in the GT 4.0 System Administrator's Guide. Read through this guide before continuing!

section.title: Building and installing
section.para: Java CoG Kit is distributed as part of a default GT 4.0 installation. For basic installation instructions, see the GT 4.0 System Administrator's Guide. No extra installation steps are required for this component.

The following are optional instructions for more advanced types of installations. These are for those advanced users who want to build the latest code from CVS or are just interested in the Java CoG Kit.

entry.para: Obtain the source code for Java CoG Kit:

listitem.para: To get the latest source from CVS execute: cvs -d :pserver:anonymous@cvs.globus.org:/home/dsl/cog/CVS \ checkout jglobus
Optionally specify -r globus_4_0_branch revision to get the latest source code for GT 4.0.x releases.
Change into the jglobus directory. cd jglobus
Untar or unzip the distribution archive. tar xvfz cog-XXX-src.tar.gz
Change into the unpacked distribution directory. cd cog-XXX

row.entry: Untar or unzip the distribution archive. tar xvfz cog-XXX-tar.gz
Change into the unpacked distribution directory. cd cog-XXX

Set the COG_INSTALL_PATH environment variable to the unpacked distribution directory.
On Windows: set COG_INSTALL_PATH=c:\cog-1.2
On Unix/Linux: setenv COG_INSTALL_PATH /soft/cog-1.2/ or export COG_INSTALL_PATH=/soft/cog-1.2/

section.title: Configuring
section.para: In general no extra configuration is required to use Java CoG Kit. However, in certain cases additional configuration might be required. The Java CoG Kit configuration file is placed in $HOME/.globus/cog.properties on Unix/Linux machines or %USERPROFILE%\.globus\cog.properties on Windows machines.

section.title: Proxy file location
section.para: By default Java CoG Kit will try to use the same proxy file as used by the C tools. However, in certain cases Java CoG Kit might fail to determine the right proxy file location. section.para: Sometimes, especially on machines with DHCP enabled, the local IP address of the machine might be incorrectly detected by Java or the wrong non-public IP address might be used if behind a NAT router or on VPN. This has the same effect as setting the GLOBUS_HOSTNAME environment property or Java system property.

section.title: Signing Policy Location
section.para: Signing policies are read in from the same directory as trusted certiricates. All files with <caHash>.signing_policy in the same directory as trusted certificates are loaded for processing. By default signing policies are NOT enforced.
Signing policy enforcement can be enabled by setting a system property java.security.gsi.signing.policy to "yes" or "true".

section.title: Troubleshooting
section.para: Please see the FAQ and the web page for any problems concerning Java CoG Kit. Also, you can send email describing your problem to the java@globus.org mailing list (must subscribe first) or search for the problem in the archives.
